name: Musket Cove Island Resort

reviews.text: THIS PLACE WAS AMAZING,
reviews.title: fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed on the Armstrong Island just across the little bridge,only 10 Bures ans a Private Pool between them, the most friendliest people who know you by your names, can recommend Dicks Place for good food and Kava!!! u must try it,
reviews.title: Lots of lovely aspects; depends if it's your scene...

likes.liked: — The lovely big attractive bure, staff friendliness overall, bicycles, general store, sense of somewhere to go, adventures...
likes.disliked: — Disappointing food, almost no pool shade, no kids club, mosquitoes, very tidal water and created waterways...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beaches are to die for, great Snorkelling, fab Sunsets, & a Massage on the beach is a must,
reviews.title: Returned -and just as great the 2nd time

likes.disliked: — The overpriced spa (unless they are offering 50% off deals) and the stiff sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just wanted to stay forever but a long way from Britain we were in Oz at the time!! would deffo go back to this Island!!!
reviews.title: The best holiday ever!

reviews.text: As a family of two adults and one eleven year old child, we stayed first at Treasure Island for about 6 days and then at Musket Cove for about five days, all over the Christmas/New Year period. These are very different experiences, though I'd be hard pushed to recommend one over the other because really, they're incomparable. We were very warmly welcomed to Musket Cove with a tropical juice, and driven in a shaded buggy quickly to our lagoon bure, stopping just briefly on the way to be shown the basics - the pool, the main eating area, activities booking area, etc. Tired from travel, and hot, we were very pleased to be quickly oriented and then taken to our accommodation where we could relax in privacy, rather than be 'processed'. We were also struck by the pristine, controlled feeling of the place - nice in some ways but not necessarily warm or authentic in its feel.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: We holidayed in Fiji for the first time In May (Family of Four, 2 Adults and 11 and 8 yr old children) and decided to stay at Musket Cove based on other traveller reviews. Following our stay we believe we made the right choice !.
reviews.title: First Time To Musket Cove, We'll Be Back !

likes.liked: — Friendly Staff, Good Food, Good Range of Activities

reviews.text: We arrived on the Malolo Cat Ferry from Denarau and were met by singing staff and fresh coconut with straw to drink the milk. We were taken by golf cart for a tour of the island and to check in, baggage etc was handled by the staff. After settling in and enjoying the facilities for a week, I can summarise our stay as follows :
reviews.title: A wonderful relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) The resort is spread out and does not feel cramped like others we have been to. We stayed in a resort villa which had its own kitchen and two bedrooms. I liked the fact there are no concrete paths!
reviews.title: Idyllic!

reviews.text: 2) Musket Cove shares the same island as Plantation Island resort and you can walk to Plantation Island in about 10 min. Plantation Island is a much larger complex aimed at the budget conscious family (and certainly attracted a different guest to Musket Cove) and it felt like you were surrounded by hundreds of other people. You can use their facilities (i.e. restaurant etc) but enjoy in short bursts. If I had a choice, spend extra to stay at Musket Cove.
reviews.title: Great Place, Shame About The Food
A great Fiji family holiday!
reviews.text: 3) The staff at Musket Cove are fantastic. Special mention to Joe the new Manager (Hi from "Michael Jackson"), Dee in the activities shed (Hi from Megan), Lotte the boat driver and coconut shredder, Kini the friendliest waitress known to man kind (from Chris & Megan) and Sharon the waitress (in fact all the waitress staff for their hard work whilst we lazed by the pool).

reviews.title: Heaven On Earth
reviews.text: My husband and I, together with our 4 + 5 yr olds spent an amazing 7 days at Musket Cove. This is our second year in a row staying at Musket Cove. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa, which was perfect. The children could enjoy their own space and earlier bed time, while we relaxed in the lounge room or in the balcony plunge pool enjoying the bottle of 'with comps' red wine. The staff were incredibly friendly and seemed to genuinely enjoy our children. As we were wanting a relaxing family holiday we spent most of our time around the pool or on the beach. The tide seemed to be out during the hottest part of the day so we either were having a siesta or swimming in the pool. The water had very little chlorine (specialised filtration system) and was like swimming in a fresh water pond. Great with two little water babies! We did venture out on two snorkelling trips and hired a bike to explore the other resorts. Returning, with relief, to the peace and quiet of Musket Cove. We will be returning again to enjoy the quietly luxurious, yet low key atmosphere. We have previously stayed on other islands in the Manumaca group, but Musket Cove is definately the best value for money if you are looking for a relaxing holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my fourth visit to this island, the thrid to this resort. This has been my best visit yet.
reviews.title: You need to go here

likes.liked: — The open bures and the massiveness of the rooms

reviews.text: In this resort you will find the true fijian holiday experience, beautiful accommodations, excellent facilities, gorgeous sunsets, sensational snorkelling and best of all, the best hotel staff on the planet.
reviews.title: Great moorings, laid back atmosphere

reviews.text: We stayed in the lagoon bures, which are wonderful. They have timber shutters surrounding the bure which can be open or shut, the rooms are massive and the bathrooms are large. They are decorated beautifully in tradiitonal style.
reviews.title: What a letdown

reviews.text: The snorkelling around the island is excellent, and as a guest you can take part in the two daily snorkelling trips free of charge. You get talken in a small boat to a local area, the corals and fish are amazing.
reviews.title: 40th Birthday in Paradise

reviews.text: We have just spent nine days in a resort villa at Musket Cove. It was our second visit we enjoyed the first so much that we returned. The highlights for us 2 adults 3children 13,8,7 were the snorkelling trips-watching the rugby ( the Fijian South African quater final) and the Fijian Independance Day celebrations. The staff put on a fanatstic show and the men proved to be very good dancers!!!!. It was agoood time of year to go. The resort Villa was great to be in it meant we could cook some of our own meals and make use of the Trader Shop.
reviews.title: Great Family Holiday

reviews.text: One or two things had changed since our last visit. A new channel is inthe process of construction in the middle of the bay between Musket Cove and Plantation Resort and is very unsightly at present. My husband was not able to take a carton of Fiji Bitter on the Malalo Cat from the mainland which upset him greatly!!!. Something to do with Licence laws on the island. It had to be left at the port.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: the bikes which were free to use last time now cost $90 per week which cost us $270 for our three children.
reviews.title: Fab Place for young & old alike

likes.liked: — Fully furnished kitchen,/cooking facilities, 2 x ensuites

reviews.text: It was a fantastic holiday but hope this helps future travellers to know the above info.
reviews.title: We love this place and Fiji!!!

likes.liked: — The staff and beauty of the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here during August with two children (10 & 12) and 4 adults staying in one of the Villa's at the resort.
reviews.title: Love It, a must to stay

aka: Musket Cove Island Hotel Malolo Lailai Island
